definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: This must be the dawn of wizard hipsters.
sentences.chinese: 這一定是巫師嬉皮士的黎明。

sentences.english: Kingston talks like one of these old hippies herself.
sentences.chinese: 湯亭亭說話的樣子好像自己就是那些嬉皮士的一員。

sentences.english: In this paper, the first chapter primarily analyzes the historical background of the hippy movement.
sentences.chinese: 論文第一章主要分析嬉皮士運動發生的歷史背景。

sentences.english: Unschoolers are hippies, eat granola and sprouts, and wear sandals.
sentences.chinese: 非學校教育者是嬉皮士，喫麥片和新鮮蔬菜，穿拖鞋。

sentences.english: “Suit” was the chosen insult of hippies to describe a dull establishment man.
sentences.chinese: 西服曾被嬉皮士戲稱爲乏味的人的衣着標誌。

sentences.english: And I’ve been called a hippie.
There was a kind of social revolution. There were many hippies.
sentences.chinese: 有一個社會運動，出現很多嬉皮士。

sentences.english: I think it was one of those hippie fucks who first said he wouldn't fight.
sentences.chinese: 我想嬉皮士們是他媽的第一個說，我不會還手的。
當然，隊伍中有跳舞的嬉皮士。

sentences.english: Frugal living was green before hippies and treehuggers, too.
sentences.chinese: 節儉的生活要比嬉皮士和喜愛自然要環保得多。

sentences.english: My parents are former hippies who never bothered to enumerate house rules.
sentences.chinese: 我父母是前嬉皮士，從來都不費心去列舉家裏的規矩。

sentences.english: The hippies believed in free love and self expression .
sentences.chinese: 嬉皮士崇尚自由愛情和自我表達。

sentences.english: You're a long-haired hippie professor from the university.
sentences.chinese: 他接着說道，你是從大學裏來的長頭髮嬉皮士教授。

sentences.english: The hippies believed in free love and self expression.
sentences.chinese: 嬉皮士相信無拘束的愛和自我表達。

sentences.english: The hippies believe in free love and self expression.
sentences.chinese: 嬉皮士崇尚自由戀愛和自我表達。

definition: decadents (of the Decadent movement of late 19th century Europe)
Ernesto Che Guevara (1928-1967), Cuban Revolution leader
